EXIT   X

DUTIES OF OFFICERS

Page

Table of Contents

 

 

Do you remember the scenario?

 

 

Could Jason be held personally liable for Travel Solutions breaching any of its WHS duties owed to Anthony?

Scenario

 

Travel Solutions is a large travel agency.

 

The old air conditioners installed in the Travel Solutions call centre stopped working two weeks ago. During a board meeting, the directors discuss whether to use Travel Solutions’ limited budget to upgrade the air conditioners.

 

The company directors recognise that installing new air conditioners would reduce risks to the health and safety of Travel Solutions employees. However, one director, named Jason, argues that the money should be spent on marketing instead. The rest of the Board agrees.

 

Anthony works in the call centre. While talking to a client, he begins to feel unwell due to the extreme heat and inadequate airflow. He collapses and is taken to hospital suffering from heatstroke and dehydration.

No, because Jason did not think that the company's broken air conditioning posed a serious threat to workers’ health and safety

Yes, Jason could be personally liable for failing to exercise due diligence to prevent Travel Solutions from breaching its WHS duties

No, it was reasonable for Jason to decide that it was in the best interests of the company to spend the money on marketing rather than new air conditioners

 
 
 

That is incorrect

 

As an officer of Travel Solutions, Jason may be personally liable for failing to exercise due diligence to ensure Travel Solutions complied with its WHS duties if he did not understand the hazards and risks associated with the business' operations.

That is correct!

 

As Jason is an officer of the company, he owes a positive duty to exercise due diligence to ensure that Travel Solutions complies with all of its duties under the WHS Act.

That is incorrect

 

As Jason is an officer of the company, he owes a positive duty to exercise due diligence to ensure that Travel Solutions complies with all of its duties under the WHS Act.
